Which Halloween (Uncut Version) are you talking about 720p from last week because I found 2 versions of first Halloween small-size 368 MB one by gunnsalius which was supposedly uncut but it was 1 hr 27 mins & 345 MB one done by on.off.on 1 hr 30 mins & the copy i have in a larger size is 1 hr 41 mins.

@bcgaran: To clarify:

BluRay was released as normal movie only.

Uncut doesn't exist. Extended version does - but it is not what some think it is - or at least, what is considered as "Extended". It was released once in 2001, as "collector's DVD - sort of "unofficial"

In that DVD are inserted filmed scenes for TV in order to fill the time slot (12 minutes of additional footage (4 scenes) and has been put into. Scenes were supposedly shot in 1980, when the film was released on CultTV. The scenes were shot using the cast and crew of Halloween II (real downer) and directed by John Carpenter, himself. 

However, BluRay was requested.

720p was requested (DVDrip can be max. 480p by nature).

It is unclear how the scenes shot supposedly in time of filming of One use - the cast of sequel.

"Filling the time slot" sounds as one shitty explanation - and I ripped original, because it is good as it is.
